Package net.ucanaccess.util

Class Try<V,EC extends Throwable>

java.lang.Object
net.ucanaccess.util.Try<V,EC>
Type Parameters:
V - the type of the optional value from the code block executed within @code try}
EC - the type of exception, if any, thrown by the executed code block.
public final class Try<V,EC extends Throwable> extends Object
Fluent-style try-catch handling.

Try objects are constructed using the catching(IThrowingRunnable) or catching(IThrowingSupplier) factories from code blocks which may or may not throw checked or unchecked (run-time) exceptions.
The exception is dealt with inside the Try instance. The class provides methods to access the result, access the exception, use an alternative result if an exception occurred, transform the result to another result amongst other methods.
Try instances are immutable.

Usage example: 

     // In this sample we query the last modification timestamp of a path p.
     // The API throws IOException (if an I/O error occurs).

     Path p = Path.of("a_path");

     // Code using a conventional try/catch construct looks like this:
     String str1 = null;
     try {
         str1 = Files.getLastModifiedTime(p).toString();
     } catch (IOException _ex) {
         str1 = "unknown";
     }
     System.out.println("1: File time is: " + str1);

     // The same using Try:
     Try<FileTime, IOException> tc1 = Try.catching(() -> Files.getLastModifiedTime(p));

     // Perform a transformation of the internal value. Here FileTime is mapped to its string representation.
     Try<String, Throwable> tc2 = tc1.map(FileTime::toString);

     String str2 = tc2.orElse("unknown");
     System.out.println("2: File time is: " + str2);

     // The same on a single line:
     System.out.println("3: File time is: " + Try.catching(() -> Files.getLastModifiedTime(p).toString()).orElse("unknown"));

     // Similarly the class supports try-with-resources scenarios such as:
     List<File> files = Try.withResources(() -> Files.walk(p), w -> {
         return w.filter(Files::isRegularFile)
                 .map(Path::toFile)
                 .collect(Collectors.toList());
     }).orIgnore();
Since:
v5.1.0
Author:
Markus Spann

    If an exception occurs during resource creation, this execution is thrown and thus processing ends.

    • catching

      public static <R, EC extends Throwable> Try<R,EC> catching(IThrowingSupplier<R,EC> _catchable)
      Creates a new instance from a throwing Supplier.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of value supplied by the supplier
      EC - the type of exception, if any, thrown by the supplier
      Parameters:
      _catchable - a throwing supplier
      Returns:
      new instance

    • catching

      public static <EC extends Throwable> Try<Void,EC> catching(IThrowingRunnable<EC> _catchable)
      Creates a new instance from a throwing Runnable.
      Type Parameters:
      EC - the type of exception, if any, thrown by the runnable
      Parameters:
      _catchable - a throwing runnable
      Returns:
      new instance

    • withResources

      public static <R extends AutoCloseable, ES extends Throwable, V, EC extends Throwable> Try<V,EC> withResources(IThrowingSupplier<R,ES> _resourceSupplier, IThrowingFunction<R,V,EC> _catchable)
      Try-with-resources support for a single resource.
      The resource is created and returned by _resourceSupplier and processed in _catchable.
      If an exception occurs during resource creation, this execution is thrown and thus processing ends.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of resource (must implement AutoCloseable)
      ES - the type of exception, if any, thrown by the resource supplier
      V - the type of value returned by the function
      EC - the type of exception, if any, thrown by the function
      Parameters:
      _resourceSupplier - the resource supplier
      _catchable - the function executed on the resource
      Returns:
      new instance

    • withResources

      public static <R extends AutoCloseable, ES extends Throwable, EC extends Throwable> Try<Void,EC> withResources(IThrowingSupplier<R,ES> _resourceSupplier, IThrowingConsumer<R,EC> _catchable)
      Try-with-resources support for a single resource with a Void (no) result.

      public <V1, E1 extends Throwable> Try<V1,E1> map(Function<? super V,? extends V1> _mapper)

      Type Parameters:

      _mapper - mapping function
      Returns:

    • orElse

      public V orElse(V _other)
      Returns the successful value or if an exception has occurred returns _other.
      Parameters:
      _other - the value to be returned, if an exception has occurred. May be null.
      Returns:
      the successful value, otherwise the _other value

    • orElse

      public void orElse(IThrowingConsumer<EC,Throwable> _consumer)
      Executes _consumer with the exception as parameter, if an exception has occurred.
      If an exception occurs during execution of the throwing consumer, that exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      _consumer - consumer to execute in case of exception. The exception object is passed to the consumer.

    • orElseApply

      public V orElseApply(IThrowingFunction<EC,V,Throwable> _function)
      If an exception has occurred, executes _function with the exception as parameter to retrieve an alternative value, otherwise returns the value.
      Parameters:
      _function - function to execute in case of exception. The exception object is passed to the function.
      Returns:
      the successful value or value returned by the function

    • orElseGet

      public V orElseGet(IThrowingSupplier<V,Throwable> _supplier)
      If an exception has occurred, executes _supplier to get an alternative value, otherwise returns the value.
      Parameters:
      _supplier - supplier that supplies an alternative value
      Returns:
      the successful value or value returned by the supplier

    • orIgnore

      public V orIgnore()
      Returns the value on success or null ignoring any prior exception.
      Returns:
      the successful value or null

    • orThrow

      public V orThrow()
      Returns the successful value or throws the exception that occurred earlier.
      Returns:
      the successful value

    • orThrow

      public <T2 extends Throwable> V orThrow(Function<EC,T2> _function) throws T2
      Returns the successful value or throws the exception returned by _function.
      The function is applied if this object has previously thrown and must provide an exception.
      Type Parameters:
      T2 - the type of exception returned by _function
      Parameters:
      _function - non-null function to provide an exception. The previous exception object is passed to the function.
      Returns:
      the successful value
      Throws:
      T2 - the exception returned by _function
